thread.title: George Michael's boyfriend shares touching snap as he denies he's banned from funeral amid claims he faces EVICTION
thread.title_full: George Michael's boyfriend shares touching snap as he denies he's banned from funeral amid claims he faces EVICTION

author: Natalie Evans
title: George Michael's boyfriend shares touching snap as he denies he's banned from funeral amid claims he faces EVICTION
text:
Showbiz George Michael's boyfriend shares touching snap as he denies he's banned from funeral amid claims he faces EVICTION Fadi Fawaz hit back as it emerged the singer's family will be forced to wait even longer to bury him as drug tests hold up the release of his body Share Fadi Fawaz shared this touching snap of him and George Michael (Photo: Fadi Fawaz/Twitter) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
George Michael ’s partner has shared a touching snap of the couple as he hit back at fresh reports he has been banned from the singer’s funeral. 
Fadi Fawaz posted an intimate black and white picture of the star planting a tender kiss on his forehead and he wraps him arm around him. 
He also posted a defiant denial of repeated claims that he has been banned from George's funeral. 
Fadi wrote on Twitter: "Let me make it clear that I'M NOT BANNED TO GO TO THE FUNERAL none of it is true, ITS NOT TRUE, NOT TRUE NOT TRUE NOT TRUE" Twitter picture of singer George Michael and his partner Fadi Fawaz (Photo: Internet Unknown) 
It comes as the superstar's family faced an even longer wait to bury their loved one . 
The Sun on Sunday reports that a hold-up over toxicology tests means the coroner cannot release George's body for a further four weeks. 
This means his grieving relatives may have to wait until next month to bury the singer – three months after he was found dead on Christmas Day. 
The agonising wait is putting an “intolerable” strain on the star’s family, sources close to them claimed. 
They said George ’s devastated dad Kyriacos Panayiotou had struggled to leave his house since his son’s death. 
A source told the Sun on Sunday: “Everyone is upset and mystified by the delay. 
“They just don’t understand why it is taking so long.” George Michael and Fadi Fawaz outside the star's London home (Photo: Splash News) 
The newspaper also reports that Fadi is facing eviction from the star's £2.5million home in central London. 
George’s assets are reportedly set to be frozen with an executor appointed to manage his £105million estate - including turning off the gas and electricity at the property. 
The Wham! star’s cousin, Andros Georgiou, previously claimed fine art photographer Fadi would not be allowed to attend the private service because the “family hate him”. 
Andros had previously claimed: “Fadi has not been invited to the funeral. He is not welcome, the family hate him. Heaven help him if he turned up. 
“Fadi was not really his boyfriend. No one has spoken to him and he just seems to be getting on with his life. It makes my stomach turn.” George Michael's chidlhood friend, Andros Georgiou (Photo: BBC) 
The Ambulance Service are currently probing the release of the 999 call at the weekend made by Fadi upon finding George’s body. 
The Sunday Mirror told how George’s family condemned the leak of the audio in a statement 
“George’s family and friends are extremely upset and truly appalled that such a personal, painful and clearly confidential recording has been leaked to the media,” the family’s lawyers. 
“On their behalf we will be ensuring that a full investigation takes place to establish how this material was made available and we will expect the culprit(s) to be dealt with appropriately. 
“We firmly believe that anyone contacting the emergency authorities in situations such as this should be entitled to expect that recordings will not be released to the media and it is deeply distressing to the family that this transcript, and audio recording, has been made public.” 
Cops are treating George’s death as unexplained but non-suspicious. They are preparing a report to the Oxfordshire Coronor and have quizzed Fadi twice in order to put it together. 
The Mirror has previously revealed how Fadi claimed to have slept the night in his car on Christmas Eve – leaving George to die alone. Like us on Facebook
